The curse of the ninth is a superstition connected with the history of classical 
music. In essence, it is the belief that a ninth symphony is destined to be a 
composer's last; i.e. that the composer will be fated to die after writing it, ... Then 
he wrote his Ninth Symphony and thought he had beaten the curse, but died with 
his Tenth...
